alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Western Hanover (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...CENTRAL GOOCHLAND...NORTHWESTERN HENRICO...WEST CENTRAL HANOVER AND NORTH CENTRAL POWHATAN COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gum Spring, or near Goochland, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Oilville around 620 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rockville, Dabneys, Sandy Hook, Vontay, Maidens, Irwin, Johnsons Springs, Goodall, Short Pump, and Mabelton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
